intro: Hieracium auriculiforme subsp. schultziorum, commonly known as the Schultze's dandelion, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and heart-shaped leaves. This subspecies is native to parts of Europe and is often found in meadows and grasslands. It produces a distinctive seed head that disperses its seeds via the wind. The plant has a taproot system and is relatively short-lived, typically growing to a height of about 20–40 centimeters.
